avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from northerly directions, sometimes easily released wind slabs will form in the course of the day at high altitude. They will be deposited on unfavourable layers. The fresh snow of the last few days and in particular the wind slabs to be found in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain can be released by a single winter sport participant. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
In very isolated cases avalanches can penetrate down to the ground and reach quite a large size.
Small and medium-sized dry avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses, especially at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, and on very steep slopes, in the event of solar radiation in particular on sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs require caution. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and up to 40 cm in some localities, has fallen since Tuesday above approximately 2000 m. In some regions 10 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until Thursday above approximately 2000 m.
On Thursday the wind will be strong over a wide area. The fresh wind slabs will be deposited on unfavourable layers.
(--), in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface during the night, in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2300 m.

In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of medium dry and moist avalanches will gradually increase.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind from northwesterly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form in the course of the day at intermediate and high altitudes. They will be deposited on unfavourable layers in particular on very steep north, east and southeast facing slopes, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. In particular transitions into gullies and bowls where weaknesses exist in the old snowpack are precarious. Single snow sport participants can release avalanches in some places, caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
In some places avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach medium size. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare and are difficult to recognise.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized dry and moist avalanches are to be expected, in particular on very steep sunny slopes, and at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
On Thursday the wind will be strong over a wide area. The fresh wind slabs will be deposited on a weakly bonded old snowpack. In some localities 5 to 15 cm of snow fell on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface, in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2200 m.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.

Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low altitude less snow than usual is lying. In the south-east of the region, watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of small and medium dry and moist avalanches will gradually increase.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a strong wind from northerly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form in the course of the day at intermediate and high altitudes. They will be deposited on unfavourable layers in particular on very steep northeast, east and southeast facing slopes, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. In particular transitions into gullies and bowls where weaknesses exist in the old snowpack are precarious. Single snow sport participants can release avalanches in some places, caution is to be exercised in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable). The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase at high altitude and in the high Alpine regions.
In some places avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach medium size. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare and are difficult to recognise.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized dry and moist avalanches are to be expected, in particular on very steep sunny slopes, and at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger. Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 15 cm of snow fell on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
Steep sunny slopes: Underneath the fresh snow there is a more or less load-bearing refreezing crust.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low altitude less snow than usual is lying. In the south-east of the region, watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of small and medium dry and moist avalanches will gradually increase.
